sub_concepts.name: Isotopic composition
sub_concepts.definition: The proportion of different isotopes present in a sample.

sub_concepts.name: Isotopic abundance
sub_concepts.definition: The relative amount of a particular isotope present in a sample.

sub_concepts.name: Isotopic fractionation
sub_concepts.definition: The process by which the isotopic composition of a substance changes as it moves through the Earth's geochemical cycles.

sub_concepts.name: Stable isotopes
sub_concepts.definition: Isotopes that do not radioactively decay and have a constant abundance in a given sample.

sub_concepts.name: Radioactive isotopes
sub_concepts.definition: Isotopes that radioactively decay and have a half-life, which can be used to determine the age of a sample.

sub_concepts.name: Isotope dating
sub_concepts.definition: Techniques used to determine the age of rocks or minerals based on the decay rate of radioactive isotopes.

sub_concepts.name: Isotope paleohydrology
sub_concepts.definition: The study of past hydroclimatic conditions using stable isotope analysis of water molecules.

sub_concepts.name: Isotope biogeochemistry
sub_concepts.definition: The study of the cycling and distribution of elements and their isotopes in the Earth's lithosphere, atmosphere, and hydrosphere.
